issue.title: [Fedora KDE] Tests do not pass on fresh source install - Discovery fails

content.raw: Can you provide more detail about the test failures by setting the `CTEST_OUTPUT_ON_FAILURE` environment variable and running `make test` again?
content.html: Can you provide more detail about the test failures by setting the CTEST_OUTPUT_ON_FAILURE environment variable and running make test again?

issue.title: [Fedora KDE] Tests do not pass on fresh source install - Discovery fails

content.raw: Reproduced the error on Fedora KDE 30.

issue.title: [Fedora KDE] Tests do not pass on fresh source install - Discovery fails

content.raw: Reproduced the error regarding gazebo failing to start on Fedora KDE 30 with a combination of the official `ignition-transport` package from the Fedora Repos and a source install of Gazebo.
content.html: Reproduced the error regarding gazebo failing to start on Fedora KDE 30 with a combination of the official ignition-transport package from the Fedora Repos and a source install of Gazebo.

issue.title: [Fedora KDE] Tests do not pass on fresh source install - Discovery fails

content.raw:
I did some more testing with different VMs. It seems like the problem only happens on Fedora KDE, not on classic Fedora \(using Gnome\). As Fedora KDE is a “Spin”, both flavours share the same package repositories. Therefore the issue should not be related to dependencies. Currently, I think the problem is related to different \(network\) configurations. Therefore I have some questions regarding the discovery phase:

* How is the discovery implemented?
* Which ports are used \(if any\)?
* Are there special network operations used which might require extra permissions?

‌
content.html:
I did some more testing with different VMs. It seems like the problem only happens on Fedora KDE, not on classic Fedora (using Gnome). As Fedora KDE is a “Spin”, both flavours share the same package repositories. Therefore the issue should not be related to dependencies. Currently, I think the problem is related to different (network) configurations. Therefore I have some questions regarding the discovery phase:

  • How is the discovery implemented?
  • Which ports are used (if any)?
  • Are there special network operations used which might require extra permissions?

‌

issue.title: [Fedora KDE] Tests do not pass on fresh source install - Discovery fails

content.raw:
Workaround: `IGN_IP=127.0.0.1`

This prevents the use of distributed computing environments.
content.html:
Workaround: IGN_IP=127.0.0.1

This prevents the use of distributed computing environments.
